description: System-generated unique identifier for the document record; primary key used to join and reference this row.
Date-time the row was created or last updated, stored as numeric string with milliseconds (YYYYMMDDhhmmssSSS); time zone not explicit—confirm with SME.
Human-readable title or description of the attached file or record used for search and display.
Stored document payload and/or metadata, commonly serialized as XML; includes an internal document identifier used to locate the file in storage.
Identifier of the parent entity this document is linked to. Used with parentr to resolve the relationship; foreign key to the parent record.
Type of the parent entity referenced by parent (e.g., equipment or work order); determines which table to query for the parent ID.
Identifier of the corresponding record in a legacy source system; enables cross-reference during migration; may be null.
Name of the legacy source table or module where the document originated; primarily for migration or audit; may be null.
Boolean flag indicating whether the document is inactive/archived (true) versus active (false).
Document or transaction date in YYYYMMDD format, used for filing, sorting, and reporting; exact meaning may vary by document type—confirm with SME.
